content: The PR killing int multiplication diamonds is almost live, but not quite. I had overlooked in the previous #7084 that this creates problems for abel since the normal form for nat multiplication is not any more •ℕ (which does not exist) but n • ... for a natural n. And abel is confused by this. I had not noticed it in the previous PR for lack of tests showing the issue, but this came up here. So, I added some tests in test/abel.lean, which are now failing. @Mario Carneiro , do you think you could fix abel about this (I guess it's just a few lines, but I don't understand its inner workings to do it myself)?
